intro: Adhatoda orixensis, commonly known as the African Trumpet Tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and can grow up to 10 meters in height, making it a notable tree in its native habitat. Its flowers are typically pink or purple and attract various pollinators such as bees and birds. Adhatoda orixensis is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
